The Lord has heard the humiliating censure that had been given to those who had not rebellion in their hearts, who thought they were doing just what they were told to do. The Lord saw (87) that His work would be marred if the directions given by men were followed, and He guided the minds of the workers to do the work in the 


                              -56- 

very way that He wished it done. The workers did not follow the plan laid out by men, because God had a better plan for them. The divine guiding produced the right result. . .
